intro: Eschscholzia unguiculata, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppies, and is characterized by its vibrant orange or red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. The California poppy is also known for its distinctive seed pods, which split open when mature to release the seeds.
